In general, a disease is a condition that impairs normal functioning and causes harm to an organism. Examples of diseases include cancer, diabetes, and HIV/AIDS. If a paragraph contains information about any of these conditions or any other conditions that impair normal functioning and cause harm to an organism, then those conditions would be considered diseases and I would be able to identify and keep them as relevant entities.

| diabetes |
| HIV/AIDS |

In this example, the table contains three diseases: cancer, diabetes, and HIV/AIDS. These diseases are presented in the table exactly as they appear in the original paragraph.

I hope this helps clarify the process. Please let me know if you have any further questions or if you would like me to process a paragraph that contains information about diseases.
